name: Twilight Knights
overview: WILIGHT KNIGHTS, the English version of RYCERZE MROKU, was scheduled for shareware release in 1997 outside of Poland, but never materialised. In 2006, however, the developers granted permission for the game to be made available for download. Coding by Mariusz "MDW" Wlodarczyk. Graphics by Karol "Caro" Wlodarczyk and ASL; digitising by Tomasz Rogala. Music by Artur "Mobby" Pietrzak. Rycerze Mroku is a first person perspective fantasy martial art game. The goal of the game is to defeat the evil minions and save the world. Each duel is preceded by a text introduction and animation of opponent's skills. The fight itself takes place in a FPP one screen view. The player may release a few types of attacks and defensive moves. The characters are described by two indicators - energy level (falls after each hit) and the level of reflexes (falls during the attack).
